summary: The document is a confidential staff action memo concerning the release of records under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992. It outlines the process of contacting a former employee, whose name appears in documents under review for public release, to seek consent for the disclosure. The employee agreed to the release, mentioning that his past association with a host government in 1971 was already known in Costa Rica.
key_findings: The document involves the review and potential release of records under the JFK Assassination Records Collection Act.
A former employee was contacted about his name appearing in documents to be released publicly.
The employee agreed to the release of his name, noting his past association with a host government in 1971 was public knowledge.
The memo demonstrates the procedure of notifying individuals named in documents prior to public release and securing their consent or objections.
